name: Change Launchpad grid columns
description: Change the Launchpad grid layout to this many columns. By default, it displays 7 columns.
author: Alan Tai

name: Change Launchpad grid rows
description: Change the Launchpad grid layout to this many rows. By default, it displays 5 rows.
author: Alan Tai

name: Disable disk image verification
description: You can skip disk image file checksum verification to speed up the mounting of disk images through this is not recommended by security experts or Apple. Specify 'true' to disable disk image verification and 'false' to enable it.
author: Alan Tai

name: Disable Gatekeeper
description: Gatekeeper requires applications to be signed before they can be run. However, code signing is a paid process and not all developers sign their applications. It gets annoying when it won't let you oepn an application that you know is safe. Specify 'true' to disable Gatekeeper and 'false' to enable it.
author: Alan Tai

name: Disable Game Center daemon
description: Game Center daemon continues to run even when you have disabled Game Center. Specify 'true' to disable Game Center daemon and 'false' to enable it.
author: Alan Tai

name: Disable smart quotes
description: macOS automatically converts straight quotes to smart quotes. But for developers, it's annoying to have to manually change them back. Specify 'true' to disable smart quotes and 'false' to enable it.
author: Alan Tai

name: Disable smart dashes
description: macOS automatically converts straight dashes to smart dashes. But for developers, it's annoying to have to manually change them back. Specify 'true' to disable smart dashes and 'false' to enable it.
author: Alan Tai

name: Disable the Sudden Motion Sensor
description: The Sudden Motion Sensor is a hardware feature that detects sudden movement and can be used to protect the hard drive. However, it can also cause problems when you are using a laptop on an uneven surface and it is unnecessary if your MacBook ships with an SSD drive. Specify 'true' to disable the Sudden Motion Sensor and 'false' to enable it.
author: Alan Tai

name: Disable hibernation
description: macOS copies the current RAM contents to a file on the disk drive and then shuts down. This is useful if you want to resume your work after a power outage. However, it can cause problems to some applications and it shortens the lifespan of your SSD drive. Specify 'true' to disable hibernation and 'false' to enable it.
author: Alan Tai

name: Disable Photos from opening automatically
description: macOS automatically opens Photos every time you insert a memory card or connect a device. Specify 'true' to disable Photos from opening automatically and 'false' to enable it.
author: Alan Tai

name: Change default screenshot location
description: Change the default location where screenshots are saved. By default, it saves screenshots to the desktop.
author: Alan Tai

name: Display thumbnail after screenshot
description: Display a thumbnail of the screenshot after taking a screenshot. Specify 'true' to display a thumbnail and 'false' to not display a thumbnail.
author: Alan Tai

name: Change screenshots format
description: By default, macOS saves screenshots in PNG format. Supported formats are 'jpg', 'tiff', 'gif', 'pdf', and 'png'.
author: Alan Tai

name: Disable screenshot shadow
description: By default, macOS adds a shadow to screenshots. Specify 'true' to disable the shadow and 'false' to enable it.
author: Alan Tai

name: Include date in screenshot filenames
description: By default, macOS saves screenshots with the filename 'Screen Shot YYYY-MM-DD at HH.MM.SS AM/PM'. Specify 'true' to include the date in the filename and 'false' to disable it.
author: Alan Tai

name: Change subpixel font rendering on external monitors
description: If you are running macOS on a Mac without a retina display, or with an external monitor that does not have an ultra-high resolution screen, you may have noticed that some fonts and text can appear as blurry and difficult to read. This is because macOS is rendering the text using subpixel font rendering. Specify '1' if you want less text smoothing, '2' if you want medium-level text smoothing, and '3' if you want even more text smoothing.
author: Alan Tai

name: Show file extensions in Finder
description: By default, macOS hides file extensions in Finder. Specify 'true' to show file extensions and 'false' to hide them.
author: Alan Tai

name: Show hidden files in Finder
description: By default, macOS hides hidden files in Finder. Specify 'true' to show hidden files and 'false' to hide them.
author: Alan Tai

name: Change sidebar icon size in Finder
description: Change the size of the icons in the sidebar of Finder. Specify '1' (smallest), '2', or '3' (largest).
author: Alan Tai

name: Show status bar in Finder
description: By default, macOS hides the status bar in Finder. Specify 'true' to show the status bar and 'false' to hide it.
author: Alan Tai

name: Show Quit option in Finder
description: By default, macOS hides the Quit option in Finder. Specify 'true' to show the Quit option and 'false' to hide it.
author: Alan Tai

name: Keep folders on top when sorting by name in Finder
description: By default, Finder sorts a directory's contents by name, with both files and folders arranged alongside one another based upon an alphabetical sorting of their names. Specify 'true' to keep folders on top and 'false' to keep the default behavior.
author: Alan Tai

name: Disable warnings when changing file extensions in Finder
description: macOS warns you when you change a file extension. Specify 'true' to disable the warning and 'false' to enable it.
author: Alan Tai

name: Set default view style in Finder
description: Finder can display files in a variety of ways and it may open up with a different view style each time. Specify 'Nlsv' for list view, 'icnv' for icon view, 'clmv' for column view, 'Flwv' for cover flow view, and 'glyv' for gallery view.
author: Alan Tai

name: Enable spring loading for directories in Finder
description: A spring-loaded folder pops open when you drag something onto its icon while holding down the mouse button. Specify 'true' to enable spring loading and 'false' to disable it.
author: Alan Tai

name: Change spring loading delay
description: You can customize the spring-loaded folder delay to suit your preference. The value is in seconds.
author: Alan Tai

name: Disable .DS_Store file creation on network volumes
description: macOS creates .DS_Store files on network volumes to store custom attributes of the folder. Specify 'true' to disable .DS_Store file creation and 'false' to enable it.
author: Alan Tai

name: Disable warnings about emptying trash
description: By default, macOS warns you when you empty the trash. Specify 'true' to disable the warning and 'false' to enable it.
author: Alan Tai

name: Empty trash automatically after 30 days
description: By default, macOS does not empty the trash automatically. Specify 'true' to empty the trash automatically after 30 days and 'false' to disable it.
author: Alan Tai

name: Change Dock position
description: You can change the position of the Dock to the left, bottom, or right side of the screen. Supported values are 'left', 'bottom', or 'right'.
author: Alan Tai

name: Set Dock icon size
description: You can change the size of the Dock icons to an exact number. The value is in pixels.
author: Alan Tai

name: Lock Dock icon size
description: You can lock the size of the Dock icons to prevent them from being resized. Specify 'true' to lock the size and 'false' to unlock it.
author: Alan Tai

name: Enable Dock icons spring loading
description: Dock icons can operate with the same spring-loaded features as folders. By default, this feature is disabled. Specify 'true' to enable spring loading and 'false' to disable it.
author: Alan Tai

name: Disable showing recent applications in Dock
description: By default, macOS shows three most recent applications in the Dock. Specify 'true' to disable this feature and 'false' to enable it.
author: Alan Tai

name: Change Dock animation effect
description: macOS animates the Dock when you open or close an application. The default animation effect is 'genie'. Supported values are 'genie', 'scale', or 'suck'.
author: Alan Tai

name: Disable swipe navigation in Google Chrome
description: Even if you have disabled the system-wide 'Swipe between pages' feature, Google Chrome still allows you to swipe between pages. Specify 'true' to disable swipe navigation and 'false' to enable it.
author: Alan Tai

name: Set theme to dark mode
description: Specify 'Dark' to set the theme to dark mode and 'Light' to set it to light mode.
author: Alan Tai

name: Disable iTunes media keys
description: If you have iTunes installed, when you press Play on the keyboard, or connect the headset and Bluetooth speaker, iTunes will automatically run. Specify 'true' to disable this feature and 'false' to enable it.
author: Alan Tai

name: Disable 'shake mouse pointer to locate' feature
description: By default, the mouse cursor in macOS gets really big when you shake the mouse or when you move it too quickly. Specify 'true' to disable this feature and 'false' to enable it.
author: Alan Tai

name: Put display to sleep due to inactivity
description: You can put the display to sleep for battery saving or privacy reasons. Specify the number of minutes of inactivity before the display goes to sleep.
author: Alan Tai

name: Put computer to sleep due to inactivity
description: You can put the computer to sleep for battery saving or privacy reasons. Specify the number of minutes of inactivity before the computer goes to sleep.
author: Alan Tai

name: Disable computer sleep
description: You can disable the computer from sleeping. Specify 'true' to disable computer sleep and 'false' to enable it.
author: Alan Tai

name: Always keep windows
description: macOS can remember all the tabs and windows you had open for the next time you launch it again. Specify 'true' to keep windows and 'false' to not keep them.
author: Alan Tai

name: Disable memory swap
description: You may want to disable memory swap to improve performance and prolong the SSD drive lifetime. However, this may cause the system to crash if you run out of memory. Specify 'true' to disable memory swap and 'false' to enable it.
author: Alan Tai

name: Disable crash reports
description: The crash reporter takes up a lot resources and if you are a developer, you may quickly get annoyed by the constant popups. Specify 'true' to disable crash reports and 'false' to enable it.
author: Alan Tai

name: Change software update frequency
description: macOS automatically checks for software updates but you cannot change how often it checks in System Preferences. Specify the number of days between each check.
author: Alan Tai

name: Change default shell
description: Specify the default shell. Supported values are 'bash', 'csh', 'dash', 'ksh', 'sh', 'tcsh', and 'zsh'.
author: Alan Tai

name: Disable spelling autocorrect
description: macOS automatically corrects your spelling mistakes. Specify 'true' to disable this feature and 'false' to enable it.
author: Alan Tai
